description.plain: The Kottonmouth Kings are an American hip hop “group” (currently D-Loc’s solo project as of 2021) formed in Placentia, California in 1996 by Saint Dog, D-Loc & Johnny Richter. Additional members have come and gone throughout the years, each adding different flavors to the group. The group is known for their activism in favor of legalizing cannabis, and often performing lyrics about smoking marijuana. The group plays hip hop, punk rock & rap rock songs that sometimes incorporate elements of other genres including psychedelic rock, reggae, dubstep, bluegrass & jam band. They’ve described their sound  as “rip hop”.

body.plain: The Kottonmouth Kings are an American hip hop “group” (currently D-Loc’s solo project as of 2021) formed in Placentia, California in 1996 by Saint Dog, D-Loc & Johnny Richter. Additional members have come and gone throughout the years, each adding different flavors to the group. The group is known for their activism in favor of legalizing cannabis, and often performing lyrics about smoking marijuana. The group plays hip hop, punk rock & rap rock songs that sometimes incorporate elements of other genres including psychedelic rock, reggae, dubstep, bluegrass & jam band. They’ve described their sound  as “rip hop”.

songs.full_title: Long Live the Kings by Kottonmouth Kings
songs.title: Long Live the Kings

description.plain:
The first song off Kottonmouth Kings' 2010 album titled "Long Live The Kings", this song is all about the Kings letting everyone know they're still on top of the game. Like we need reassurance.

 Johnny Richter goes first, rapping about how nobody expected the Kottonmouth Kings to ever last as long as they have, and goes on to thank everyone that helped them to get where they are now.

 D-Loc is up next basically rapping about smoking weed and still being at the top of the industry, but probably has the catchiest verse in the song.

 Daddy X is now up, telling us that they're gonna stay on top and that when the Kottonmouth Kings are all dead and gone that people will still be listening to the music, which he is stating is legendary and will make history.

 No arguments there.

 The song also introduces a new member to the Kings, The Dirtball. He goes rapping about how they've got more to offer and all that stuff, saying they can get much higher and he's one of the freshest around.


References:

 Wikipedia http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Long_Live_The_Kings

Allmusic
http://www.allmusic.com/album/long-live-the-kings-mw0001969023
